pl.bristleback.server.bristle.conf.resolver.init
Class PojoConfigResolver

java.lang.Object
  pl.bristleback.server.bristle.conf.resolver.init.PojoConfigResolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
InitialConfigurationResolver
public class PojoConfigResolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements InitialConfigurationResolver

This configuration resolver simply contains setter methods for each configuration setting. Default values are taken from DefaultConfigurationResolver instance.

Created on: 2012-01-31 17:16:26

Author:
Wojciech Niemiec

Constructor Summary
PojoConfigResolver()
          Creates an instance of initial configuration with filled default configuration values.

Method Detail

resolveConfiguration

public InitialConfiguration resolveConfiguration()
Description copied from interface: InitialConfigurationResolver
Resolves configuration settings. This method should return complete configuration settings object.

Specified by:
resolveConfiguration in interface InitialConfigurationResolver
Returns:
configuration settings object.

setAcceptedControllerNames

public void setAcceptedControllerNames(java.lang.String... acceptedControllerNames)
Sets acceptable controller names. Each client chooses one data controller from list of available controllers. Data controllers must implement DataController interface.

Parameters:
acceptedControllerNames - names of controllers to activate.

setLoggingLevel

public void setLoggingLevel(java.lang.String loggingLevel)
Sets logging level used in Bristleback application. Values should be taken from Level fields.

Parameters:
loggingLevel - logging level used in Bristleback application.

setSerializationEngine

public void setSerializationEngine(java.lang.String serializationEngine)
Sets engine used in all serialization and deserialization operations. Serialization engine must implement SerializationEngine interface.

Parameters:
serializationEngine - serialization engine implementation.

setEngineName

public void setEngineName(java.lang.String engineName)
Sets server engine. Server engine must implement ServerEngine interface.

Parameters:
engineName - server engine.

setEnginePort

public void setEnginePort(int enginePort)
Sets port on which server engine will listen for new connections. In ServletServerEngine implementations, engine port may be determined by the web server used.

Parameters:
enginePort - engine port.

setEngineTimeout

public void setEngineTimeout(int timeout)
Sets maximum connection idle time (in milliseconds), after which the connection will be closed.

Parameters:
timeout - maximum connection idle time.

setEngineMaxMessageSize

public void setEngineMaxMessageSize(int maxMessageSize)
Sets maximum message size.

Parameters:
maxMessageSize - maximum message size.

setEngineProperties

public void setEngineProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
Sets additional engine properties.

Parameters:
properties - additional engine properties.

setEngineRejectedDomains

public void setEngineRejectedDomains(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rejectedDomains)
This property is currently not used.

Parameters:
rejectedDomains - rejected domain names.

setMaxBufferSize

public void setMaxBufferSize(int bufferSize)
Sets maximum server engine buffer size for each connector.

Parameters:
bufferSize - maximum buffer size.

setUserFactory

public void setUserFactory(java.lang.String userFactory)
Sets the name of user factory bean that will be used to resolve IdentifiedUser implementations on connection start. User factory must implement UserFactory interface.

Parameters:
userFactory - user factory.
